intro: Desfontainia spinosa, commonly known as the spiny desfontainia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, spiny stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and stamens. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
